intro: Hiptage trialata, commonly known as the golden hiptage, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while the stems are hairy and often reddish in color. Hiptage trialata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant flowers and adaptability to various soil types.
